clinical_study.brief_title: Real-Ear Measurement (REM) and Test Box System Integration Into Fitting Software

brief_summary.textblock: Integration of the REM-verification within the fitting workflow will enable the hearing care professional to easily run real ear measurements. The purpose of the two study parts is to prove that an integrated cooperative system, consisting of fitting software and measurement system, matches desired responses for certain stimuli faster, more reliably and more precisely at the ear drums of hearing instrument wearers than current best practice processes.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance (mm) from probe tube to eardrum measurement
primary_outcome.description: Precise of the Probe Tube placement

primary_outcome.measure: Procedure time (min) of fitting workflow including Real Ear measurement
primary_outcome.description: In addition to the outcome measurement "time" (in minutes) further outcome measurements can be obtained due to the performed real ear measurement procedure itself. Data that give information pertaining to test reliability (in dB) and precision of hearing aid fitting (in dB).

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective rating of unpleasantness (0 = not unpleasant at all, 10 = very unpleasant)
secondary_outcome.description: Pleasantness during the probe tube placement
Perceived annoyance of the hearing care professional and the test subject measured with a questionnaire including rating scales for stessful and boring.

arm_group.description: The study arm goes through a comparative test run followed by a comparative hearing aid fitting.

intervention.intervention_name: Real-Ear Measurement system integrated in hearing aid fitting software
intervention.description: The subjects individual response of the ear canal gets measured with the help of a probe tube and a following hearing aid fitting.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clean and healthy ear canal, eardrum and pinna
- Ability to keep current position (of head and body) during a period of about 5 minutes while seated.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ear infections
- Ear wax in the ear
- Hyperacusis
- Pacemaker
- Tremor
- Disability to keep position.
